text: Kenny vs. Spenny was a Canadian reality-comedy television series created by Kenny Hotz. It starred Kenny Hotz and Spencer Rice. The series had six seasons and ran from August 26, 2003 to December 23, 2010. Matt Stone and Trey Parker, creators of South Park, were executive producers for 10 episodes in the fourth season of the show. The series was about two friends who competed in numerous competitions. The loser of the competition would have to do a humiliation that the winner picked out. The show ended with an hour-long Christmas special that aired on December 23, 2010 on Showcase. Hotz and Rice reunited in 2021 for a special on CBC titled Kenny & Spenny: Paldemic. It was nominated for Best Host, Web Program or Series at the 2021 Canadian Screen Awards. There have been attempts to bring the show back for a seventh season. Hotz said that he wanted Netflix to help with a new season after seeing the success of the revived Trailer Park Boys. The show spawned many many replicas including Frank vs Girard in French Canadian on VRAK.TV, Ed vs. Spencer in the United Kingdom, Juan vs. Roman in Latin America, Elton vs. Simon in Germany, Katja vs. Bridget and Dennis vs. Valerio in the Netherlands, and Sid vs. Varun in India. TV.com rated the series a 8.4. It was ranked as at #8 among the top 10 Canadian television shows of the 21st century. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website * * Category:2003 television series debuts Category:2000s Canadian television series debuts Category:2000s comedy television series Category:2003 establishments in Canada Category:2010 Canadian television series endings
title: Kenny vs. Spenny
